bibl.title: Letter from Rhett Milligan to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 1, 1927

div1.p: This letter, written by a student of Edith R. Force, thanks Emilie Lawrence Reed for the life and work of Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Rhett Milligan to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 1, 1927
div1.opener:
Rhett Milligan
11 East Seventeenth Street
Tulsa Oklahoma
June 1, 1927
Mrs Walter Reed
Hotel Burlington
Vermount Ave.
Washington D.C.
Dear Mrs Reed;
div1.p:
First let me introduce
myself. I am Rhett Milligan,
fourteen year old girl & put of the
Science Department of Woodrow
Wilson Jr. High School of Tulsa
Okla. Through this department
I heard of the wonderful work
of your husband and yourself.
Please accept this small note
in behalf of your reknown
and unselfish sacrifice. I
know it must give you a
feeling of content to realize
what you have done for the
good of others and please
c1
B13
believe that we and all the
other children of the United
States look upon you as an
example of unselfishness.
